headline: Crown Castle: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for funds from operations of $1.82 per share. Funds from operations is a closely watched measure in the REIT industry. It takes net income and adds back items such as depreciation and amortization.

raw.headline: Crown Castle: Q4 Earnings Snapshot

headline: Crown Castle to sell fiber assets to EQT Active Core and Zayo in $8.5 billion deal
summary: (Reuters) -Crown Castle said on Thursday it will sell its fiber assets to two entities for $8.5 billion, after activist investor Elliott Investment Management pushed the wireless tower operator for changes.  The company is selling its small cells business to EQT Active Core Infrastructure fund and its fiber solutions one to Zayo Group Holdings, each for $4.25 billion.  "Crown Castle's divestiture is a well-calculated move that should improve financial stability, enhance shareholder value, and signal a renewed focus on core strengths that is likely to be viewed favorably by the market," said Michael Ashley Schulman, chief investment officer at Running Point Capital Advisors.

The company is selling its small cells business to EQT Active Core Infrastructure fund and its fiber solutions one to Zayo Group Holdings, each for $4.25 billion.  "Crown Castle's divestiture is a well-calculated move that should improve financial stability, enhance shareholder value, and signal a renewed focus on core strengths that is likely to be viewed favorably by the market," said Michael Ashley Schulman, chief investment officer at Running Point Capital Advisors.

headline: How To Earn $500 A Month From Crown Castle Stock Ahead Of Q4 Earnings
summary: Crown Castle Inc. (NYSE:CCI) will release its fourth-quarter financial results, after the closing bell, on Thursday, March 13. Analysts expect the company to report quarterly earnings at 40 cents per share. That’s down from 86 cents per share in the year-ago period. Crown Castle projects quarterly revenue of $1.64 billion. It generated $1.67 billion a year earlier, according to data from Benzinga Pro. On Feb. 13, Citigroup analyst Michael Rollins maintained Crown Castle with a Buy rating and low
